docs.snippet: U.S. media company Meredith Corp said on Wednesday it cut about 200 jobs and would lay off another 1,000 as it streamlines its operations following the completion of its Time Inc acquisition.

headline.print_headline: Meredith to Cut About 1,200 Jobs, Sell Some Time Publications
headline.main: Meredith to Cut About 1,200 Jobs, Sell Some Time Publications

docs.snippet: Federal investigators were on Friday seeking clues about what motivated the 23-year-old man they say was responsible for the deadly Texas bombing spree and whether he had help building or planting his bombs.

headline.print_headline: Investigators Seek Clues Whether Austin Bomber Worked Alone
headline.main: Investigators Seek Clues Whether Austin Bomber Worked Alone

docs.snippet: An Iowa family of four on vacation in Mexican seaside resort was found dead inside a condominium, but foul play was not suspected, authorities and a family member said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Iowa Family of Four Found Dead in Mexico
headline.main: Iowa Family of Four Found Dead in Mexico

docs.snippet: Britain's main opposition leader vowed Monday that his Labour Party would have "zero tolerance" for anti-Semitism, after Jewish groups accused him of failing to stamp out anti-Jewish prejudice within his left-of-center party.

headline.print_headline: UK Jewish Groups Accuse Labour of Tolerating Anti-Semitism
headline.main: UK Jewish Groups Accuse Labour of Tolerating Anti-Semitism

docs.snippet: Newer versions of Google’s browser include a setting to easily mute web pages that would otherwise open with audio blaring.

headline.print_headline: How to Shut Up Noisy Sites in Chrome
headline.main: How to Shut Up Noisy Sites in Chrome

docs.snippet: France expects the European Union to obtain a full exemption from new U.S. tariffs on aluminium and steel that are due to kick in on March 23, the French finance minister Bruno Le Maire said on Monday after meeting his U.S. counterpart.

headline.print_headline: France Expects EU to Get Full Exemption From U.S. Tariffs-Le Maire
headline.main: France Expects EU to Get Full Exemption From U.S. Tariffs-Le Maire

docs.snippet: Oil prices edged up on Tuesday, lifted by tensions in the Middle East, although rising output in the United States and shaky stock markets put a lid on further gains.

headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Rise on Middle East Tension, but Soaring U.S. Output Caps Gains
headline.main: Oil Prices Rise on Middle East Tension, but Soaring U.S. Output Caps Gains

docs.snippet: Ukrainian lawmaker Nadiya Savchenko began a hunger strike on Friday to protest her detention on charges of planning a coup against the government, less than two years after being welcomed home as a national hero.

headline.print_headline: Ukraine's Savchenko Goes on Hunger Strike Over Detention
headline.main: Ukraine's Savchenko Goes on Hunger Strike Over Detention

docs.snippet: Norway's opposition Centre Party said on Friday it would join three left-wing parties in backing a no-confidence motion against Justice Minister Sylvi Listhaug, heightening the risk that the minority cabinet will fall.

headline.print_headline: Row Over Breivik Massacre Threatens Norway's Justice Minister, Cabinet
headline.main: Row Over Breivik Massacre Threatens Norway's Justice Minister, Cabinet

docs.snippet: Two women brought three children to a mosque in Tempe, Ariz., and in a video can be heard attacking Islam.

headline.print_headline: Women Arrested After Trespassing at Arizona Mosque and Mocking Islam
headline.main: Women Arrested After Trespassing at Arizona Mosque and Mocking Islam
